name: Avoid having MongoDB databases access without authentication activated
description:
Enabling access control on a MongoDB deployment enforces authentication, requiring users to identify themselves. 
        When accessing a MongoDB deployment that has access control enabled, users can only perform actions as determined by their role.
output:
List all Artifacts with access without authentication to MongoDB databases.
The following information is provided: 
- The number of violation patterns
- Bookmarks for violation patterns found in the source code
rationale:
MongoDB does not require authentication by default. Protect your database against unauthorized access by enabling database access control. 
        Enabling access control also allows you to limit actions that particular users can perform on the database.
remediation: Activate authentication to access the MongoDB database.
total: The total procedure counts MongoDB Access.
